skill.name: seo-audit
skill.description: When the user wants to audit, review, or diagnose SEO issues on their site. Also use when the user mentions "SEO audit," "technical SEO," "why am I not ranking," "SEO issues," "on-page SEO," "meta tags review," or "SEO health check." For building pages at scale to target keywords, see programmatic-seo. For adding structured data, see schema-markup.
skill.summary: Perform comprehensive SEO audits to identify technical issues, on-page optimization problems, and ranking barriers.
skill.author: coreyhaines31

security_audit.summary: Static analysis detected pattern matches in SKILL.md documentation. These are false positives triggered by SEO-related terminology (security headers, URL analysis, redirect chains). SKILL.md is documentation, not executable code. No malicious behavior or security risks identified. Safe for publication.

content.value_statement: Website owners struggle to identify why their content fails to rank in search results. This skill performs comprehensive SEO audits to diagnose technical issues, on-page optimization problems, and content gaps that prevent search visibility.
actual_capabilities: Analyze meta tags and headers for SEO optimization
Identify broken links and redirect chains
Evaluate heading hierarchy and content structure
Assess website speed and performance factors
Review internal linking and site architecture
limitations: Cannot access external websites directly - requires URL input or crawler integration
Does not perform backlink analysis or external link evaluation
Cannot modify website code or implement fixes automatically
Does not track ranking changes over time

use_cases.title: Diagnose Ranking Drops
use_cases.description: Identify why a previously ranking page has lost visibility in search results by analyzing technical factors and on-page optimization.

use_cases.title: Pre-Launch SEO Check
use_cases.description: Review a new page or site before launch to catch SEO issues early and ensure optimal ranking potential.

use_cases.title: Competitive SEO Analysis
use_cases.description: Compare your pages against competitor ranking factors to identify optimization opportunities.

prompt_templates.title: Basic SEO Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a basic SEO audit for [URL or page content]. Check the meta title, description, heading structure, and basic on-page factors.
prompt_templates.scenario: Quick check of a single page

prompt_templates.title: Technical SEO Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Conduct a technical SEO review for [URL]. Look at URL structure, canonical tags, robots.txt, sitemap, page speed indicators, and core web vitals.

prompt_templates.title: Content Optimization Guide
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the on-page SEO for [URL or content]. Analyze keyword usage, content depth, internal links, and compare against SEO best practices.

prompt_templates.title: Full Site Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a comprehensive SEO audit for [website or multiple URLs]. Include technical SEO, on-page factors, content quality, and provide prioritized recommendations.

output: - Meta Description: 'Learn SEO...' (165 chars) - Good length
- Recommendation: Add H3 sub-sections for better structure
2. Add Open Graph meta tags (medium priority)
3. Create and submit XML sitemap (medium priority)

output_examples.input: Why is my page not ranking for 'best coffee makers'?
output: - Your title: 'Coffee Maker Guide' (missing target keyword)
- Missing: Comparison tables, user reviews section
1. Include target keyword in title and H1
3. Add comparison table with feature ratings

best_practices: Run audits before publishing new content to catch issues early
Focus on fixing high-priority issues first (broken links, missing meta tags)
Compare your pages against top-ranking competitors for similar keywords
Track changes over time to measure SEO improvement progress
anti_patterns: Don't ignore technical SEO issues - they prevent content from being indexed
Don't keyword stuff titles or content - focus on natural readability
Don't forget to check mobile-friendliness and page speed factors

faq.question: What does this skill actually analyze?
faq.answer: This skill analyzes on-page SEO factors including meta tags, heading structure, URL structure, internal linking, and content optimization. For technical factors, it can evaluate robots.txt, sitemaps, and canonical tags if provided with the information.

faq.question: Can this skill crawl my entire website?
faq.answer: No. You need to provide specific URLs or content for analysis. For comprehensive site audits, provide a list of key URLs or share crawl data from tools like Screaming Frog.

faq.question: How is this different from programmatic SEO?
faq.answer: This skill audits and diagnoses existing pages. Programmatic SEO is for building many pages at scale to target keywords automatically. Use seo-audit to check your pages and programmatic-seo to create new landing pages.

faq.question: Does this skill check backlinks?
faq.answer: No. This skill focuses on on-page and technical SEO factors. Backlink analysis requires external tools like Ahrefs, Moz, or SEMrush which have access to backlink databases.

faq.question: Can it fix SEO issues automatically?
faq.answer: No. This skill diagnoses issues and provides recommendations. You or your developer must implement the fixes based on the audit findings.

faq.question: What information do I need to provide?
faq.answer: Provide the URL of the page you want audited, or paste the page content directly. For technical audits, also share any relevant files like robots.txt or share access to search console data.
